Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed led Bangladesh's charge as they beat Netherlands by 9 runs in a low scoring Super 12 encounter of the T20 World Cup in Hobart on Monday.
Taskin Ahmed finished the contest with four wickets in his quota, which saw him concede 25 runs.
Shakib Al Hasan concedes just six runs in his over as Netherlands reach 92/7 after 16 overs.
Scott Edwards sweeps it straight to Hasan Mahmud as Shakib Al Hasan provides Bangladesh with another breakthrough.
Hasan Mahmud cleans up Tim Pringle for 1.
Mustafizur Rahman is introduced into the attack and he starts off with a four-run over.
Taskin picks his another wicket as Colin Ackermann's resistance ends at 62(48).
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh bowlers responded strongly after Netherlands restricted them for 144/8 in 20 overs, helping them win the match by 9 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh vs Netherlands, T20 World Cup 2022 Highlights: Bangladesh bowlers responded strongly after Netherlands restricted them for 144/8 in 20 overs, helping them win the match by 9 runs.
The action resumes after the brief stoppage due to rain.
The game has stopped due to rain.
Netherlands are bundled out for 135 in response to Bangladesh's 144/8.
